attributes.action: Block the extradition of Julian Assange
attributes.additional_details: "The charges leveled against Assange stem from the 2010 Manning leaks... That material was received from a source who acted in what she perceived to be the public interest... An ideologically-motivated whistleblower with firsthand knowledge of the material...  forms the bedrock of public interest journalism. Any attempt to ...criminalize it by tying it to hacking on a technicality, threatens quality journalism and threatens the free media" (James Ball)
attributes.background:
The DOJ have filed criminal charges for "conspiracy to commit computer intrusion for agreeing to break a password to a classified US government computer." 

Granting extradition to the U.S. is a threat to free speech and public interest journalism and cannot be condoned by the UK government.

rejection.details:
This is a decision for the courts, which are independent of the UK Government and Parliament.

You can read more about the case here:
https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/world-affairs/europe/extradition-from-the-uk-what-next-for-julian-assange/
